description: I created this chair as a commission for a friend's game. Making the spiral decorations on the legs and the cushion shape was challenging since it's a fairly complex shape. I made a lot of mistakes along the way and learned a lot. I did most of the work in Blender on the model, with some texture work in Substance Painter. The entire process took around 40 hours.

A friend shared a robot drawings he had made, which inspired me to create a 3D version of this Red Robot. I did all the modeling and rendering in Blender and the texture work in Substance Painter. The entire process took approximately 50-60 hours. I probably spent a lot more time thinking about the model, mostly researching hydraulic systems and thinking of logical ways to connect pieces.

Believe it or not, this Cast iron stove is probably one of my favorite models. It's the first model where I created textures from scratch in Substance Designer. I also spent extra time giving everything an older, used feel in Substance Painter. I used Blender to create the model itself, with the entire modeling and texturing process taking approximately 20-30 hours.

This Cat Bed was created as a commission. I did the modeling and rendering in Blender. Unlike some of the newer models, where I've started using Substance Painter, at this point, I was using a site called CC0 textures. This is the first model where I experimented with cloth simulations, so I spent a decent chunk of time learning and refining those techniques. The entire model took approximately 30-40 hours to complete.

I created this staircase as a commission for a game. Our goal was to create a set of modular industrial-style stairs with a low polygon count. To achieve that, I did the modeling in Blender, and at this point, I was still using textures from CC0textures. I learned a lot about UV unwrapping and physics meshes during this project. The whole process took approximately 5-10 hours.

This Yellow Robot was one of the first 3D models I started on after jumping back into Blender. It was inspired by a friend who drew a version of this robot for practice. I created the model in Blender and the textures in Blenders node editor. The actual time it took to complete the model was around 20-30 hours, but a lot more time was spent learning and reacquainting myself with Blender.

This is one of the first models I created in blender. I've included it here mainly to show how far things have come since. I was also pretty happy with how the texture turned out, even though I hadn't established a good workflow at this point. I painted the model using projection from real-life pictures. This complete model took approximately 2 hours.

I created these bananas when a friend asked me how someone would make something in Blender. It was an exercise in creating something within a short timeframe more than anything else. I painted the textures in Blender using projection from real-life pictures. I completed the modeling and texturing in under 2 hours.

This bread was part of a series of other foods I created while learning Blender. Much like the apple and other food items, it's included as a point of reference. The textures were painted in Blender using projection from real-life pictures. The modeling and texturing process took approximately 4 hours.
